004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Meters;
008
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonAutoDetect;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.proto.Pose2dProto;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.struct.Pose2dStruct;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.Interpolatable;
016import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Distance;
017import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
018import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
019import java.util.Collections;
020import java.util.Comparator;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.Objects;
023
024/** Represents a 2D pose containing translational and rotational elements. */
025@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
026@JsonAutoDetect(getterVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.NONE)
027public class Pose2d implements Interpolatable<Pose2d>, ProtobufSerializable, StructSerializable {
028  /**
029   * A preallocated Pose2d representing the origin.
030   *
031   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common poses.
032   */
033  public static final Pose2d kZero = new Pose2d();
034
035  private final Translation2d m_translation;
036  private final Rotation2d m_rotation;
037
038  /** Constructs a pose at the origin facing toward the positive X axis. */
039  public Pose2d() {
040    m_translation = Translation2d.kZero;
041    m_rotation = Rotation2d.kZero;
042  }
043
044  /**
045   * Constructs a pose with the specified translation and rotation.
046   *
047   * @param translation The translational component of the pose.
048   * @param rotation The rotational component of the pose.
049   */
050  @JsonCreator
051  public Pose2d(
052      @JsonProperty(required = true, value = "translation") Translation2d translation,
053      @JsonProperty(required = true, value = "rotation") Rotation2d rotation) {
054    m_translation = translation;
055    m_rotation = rotation;
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Constructs a pose with x and y translations instead of a separate Translation2d.
060   *
061   * @param x The x component of the translational component of the pose.
062   * @param y The y component of the translational component of the pose.
063   * @param rotation The rotational component of the pose.
064   */
065  public Pose2d(double x, double y, Rotation2d rotation) {
066    m_translation = new Translation2d(x, y);
067    m_rotation = rotation;
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Constructs a pose with x and y translations instead of a separate Translation2d. The X and Y
072   * translations will be converted to and tracked as meters.
073   *
074   * @param x The x component of the translational component of the pose.
075   * @param y The y component of the translational component of the pose.
076   * @param rotation The rotational component of the pose.
077   */
078  public Pose2d(Distance x, Distance y, Rotation2d rotation) {
079    this(x.in(Meters), y.in(Meters), rotation);
080  }
081
082  /**
083   * Transforms the pose by the given transformation and returns the new transformed pose.
084   *
085   * <pre>
086   * [x_new]    [cos, -sin, 0][transform.x]
087   * [y_new] += [sin,  cos, 0][transform.y]
088   * [t_new]    [  0,    0, 1][transform.t]
089   * </pre>
090   *
091   * @param other The transform to transform the pose by.
092   * @return The transformed pose.
093   */
094  public Pose2d plus(Transform2d other) {
095    return transformBy(other);
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Returns the Transform2d that maps the one pose to another.
100   *
101   * @param other The initial pose of the transformation.
102   * @return The transform that maps the other pose to the current pose.
103   */
104  public Transform2d minus(Pose2d other) {
105    final var pose = this.relativeTo(other);
106    return new Transform2d(pose.getTranslation(), pose.getRotation());
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Returns the translation component of the transformation.
111   *
112   * @return The translational component of the pose.
113   */
114  @JsonProperty
115  public Translation2d getTranslation() {
116    return m_translation;
117  }
118
119  /**
120   * Returns the X component of the pose's translation.
121   *
122   * @return The x component of the pose's translation.
123   */
124  public double getX() {
125    return m_translation.getX();
126  }
127
128  /**
129   * Returns the Y component of the pose's translation.
130   *
131   * @return The y component of the pose's translation.
132   */
133  public double getY() {
134    return m_translation.getY();
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * Returns the X component of the pose's translation in a measure.
139   *
140   * @return The x component of the pose's translation in a measure.
141   */
142  public Distance getMeasureX() {
143    return m_translation.getMeasureX();
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Returns the Y component of the pose's translation in a measure.
148   *
149   * @return The y component of the pose's translation in a measure.
150   */
151  public Distance getMeasureY() {
152    return m_translation.getMeasureY();
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Returns the rotational component of the transformation.
157   *
158   * @return The rotational component of the pose.
159   */
160  @JsonProperty
161  public Rotation2d getRotation() {
162    return m_rotation;
163  }
164
165  /**
166   * Multiplies the current pose by a scalar.
167   *
168   * @param scalar The scalar.
169   * @return The new scaled Pose2d.
170   */
171  public Pose2d times(double scalar) {
172    return new Pose2d(m_translation.times(scalar), m_rotation.times(scalar));
173  }
174
175  /**
176   * Divides the current pose by a scalar.
177   *
178   * @param scalar The scalar.
179   * @return The new scaled Pose2d.
180   */
181  public Pose2d div(double scalar) {
182    return times(1.0 / scalar);
183  }
184
185  /**
186   * Rotates the pose around the origin and returns the new pose.
187   *
188   * @param other The rotation to transform the pose by.
189   * @return The transformed pose.
190   */
191  public Pose2d rotateBy(Rotation2d other) {
192    return new Pose2d(m_translation.rotateBy(other), m_rotation.rotateBy(other));
193  }
194
195  /**
196   * Transforms the pose by the given transformation and returns the new pose. See + operator for
197   * the matrix multiplication performed.
198   *
199   * @param other The transform to transform the pose by.
200   * @return The transformed pose.
201   */
202  public Pose2d transformBy(Transform2d other) {
203    return new Pose2d(
204        m_translation.plus(other.getTranslation().rotateBy(m_rotation)),
205        other.getRotation().plus(m_rotation));
206  }
207
208  /**
209   * Returns the current pose relative to the given pose.
210   *
211   * <p>This function can often be used for trajectory tracking or pose stabilization algorithms to
212   * get the error between the reference and the current pose.
213   *
214   * @param other The pose that is the origin of the new coordinate frame that the current pose will
215   *     be converted into.
216   * @return The current pose relative to the new origin pose.
217   */
218  public Pose2d relativeTo(Pose2d other) {
219    var transform = new Transform2d(other, this);
220    return new Pose2d(transform.getTranslation(), transform.getRotation());
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * Obtain a new Pose2d from a (constant curvature) velocity.
225   *
226   * <p>See <a href="https://file.tavsys.net/control/controls-engineering-in-frc.pdf">Controls
227   * Engineering in the FIRST Robotics Competition</a> section 10.2 "Pose exponential" for a
228   * derivation.
229   *
230   * <p>The twist is a change in pose in the robot's coordinate frame since the previous pose
231   * update. When the user runs exp() on the previous known field-relative pose with the argument
232   * being the twist, the user will receive the new field-relative pose.
233   *
234   * <p>"Exp" represents the pose exponential, which is solving a differential equation moving the
235   * pose forward in time.
236   *
237   * @param twist The change in pose in the robot's coordinate frame since the previous pose update.
238   *     For example, if a non-holonomic robot moves forward 0.01 meters and changes angle by 0.5
239   *     degrees since the previous pose update, the twist would be Twist2d(0.01, 0.0,
240   *     Units.degreesToRadians(0.5)).
241   * @return The new pose of the robot.
242   */
243  public Pose2d exp(Twist2d twist) {
244    double dx = twist.dx;
245    double dy = twist.dy;
246    double dtheta = twist.dtheta;
247
248    double sinTheta = Math.sin(dtheta);
249    double cosTheta = Math.cos(dtheta);
250
251    double s;
252    double c;
253    if (Math.abs(dtheta) < 1E-9) {
254      s = 1.0 - 1.0 / 6.0 * dtheta * dtheta;
255      c = 0.5 * dtheta;
256    } else {
257      s = sinTheta / dtheta;
258      c = (1 - cosTheta) / dtheta;
259    }
260    var transform =
261        new Transform2d(
262            new Translation2d(dx * s - dy * c, dx * c + dy * s),
263            new Rotation2d(cosTheta, sinTheta));
264
265    return this.plus(transform);
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * Returns a Twist2d that maps this pose to the end pose. If c is the output of {@code a.Log(b)},
270   * then {@code a.Exp(c)} would yield b.
271   *
272   * @param end The end pose for the transformation.
273   * @return The twist that maps this to end.
274   */
275  public Twist2d log(Pose2d end) {
276    final var transform = end.relativeTo(this);
277    final var dtheta = transform.getRotation().getRadians();
278    final var halfDtheta = dtheta / 2.0;
279
280    final var cosMinusOne = transform.getRotation().getCos() - 1;
281
282    double halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta;
283    if (Math.abs(cosMinusOne) < 1E-9) {
284      halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta = 1.0 - 1.0 / 12.0 * dtheta * dtheta;
285    } else {
286      halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta = -(halfDtheta * transform.getRotation().getSin()) / cosMinusOne;
287    }
288
289    Translation2d translationPart =
290        transform
291            .getTranslation()
292            .rotateBy(new Rotation2d(halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta, -halfDtheta))
293            .times(Math.hypot(halfThetaByTanOfHalfDtheta, halfDtheta));
294
295    return new Twist2d(translationPart.getX(), translationPart.getY(), dtheta);
296  }
297
298  /**
299   * Returns the nearest Pose2d from a list of poses. If two or more poses in the list have the same
300   * distance from this pose, return the one with the closest rotation component.
301   *
302   * @param poses The list of poses to find the nearest.
303   * @return The nearest Pose2d from the list.
304   */
305  public Pose2d nearest(List<Pose2d> poses) {
306    return Collections.min(
307        poses,
308        Comparator.comparing(
309                (Pose2d other) -> this.getTranslation().getDistance(other.getTranslation()))
310            .thenComparing(
311                (Pose2d other) ->
312                    Math.abs(this.getRotation().minus(other.getRotation()).getRadians())));
313  }
314
315  @Override
316  public String toString() {
317    return String.format("Pose2d(%s, %s)", m_translation, m_rotation);
318  }
319
320  /**
321   * Checks equality between this Pose2d and another object.
322   *
323   * @param obj The other object.
324   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
325   */
326  @Override
327  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
328    return obj instanceof Pose2d pose
329        && m_translation.equals(pose.m_translation)
330        && m_rotation.equals(pose.m_rotation);
331  }
332
333  @Override
334  public int hashCode() {
335    return Objects.hash(m_translation, m_rotation);
336  }
337
338  @Override
339  public Pose2d interpolate(Pose2d endValue, double t) {
340    if (t < 0) {
341      return this;
342    } else if (t >= 1) {
343      return endValue;
344    } else {
345      var twist = this.log(endValue);
346      var scaledTwist = new Twist2d(twist.dx * t, twist.dy * t, twist.dtheta * t);
347      return this.exp(scaledTwist);
348    }
349  }
350
351  /** Pose2d protobuf for serialization. */
352  public static final Pose2dProto proto = new Pose2dProto();
353
354  /** Pose2d struct for serialization. */
355  public static final Pose2dStruct struct = new Pose2dStruct();
356}
